medical_history.chief_complaint: Worsening fatigue, generalized weakness, and anorexia with unintentional weight loss.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 4 months prior with increasing fatigue, weakness, and anorexia. The patient also reported subjective fevers, chills, drenching night sweats, dry mouth, a nonproductive cough, dyspnea with minimal exertion, nausea with occasional emesis, and light-headedness on standing. He became largely bedridden in the preceding month.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Myasthenia gravis diagnosed 5 years ago, well controlled with mycophenolate; corneal transplantation in both eyes 15 years ago; treated for vitiligo with methoxsalen and ultraviolet radiation 40 years ago.
medical_history.social_history: Retired neuroscientist; previously smoked cigarettes but not currently; no use of alcohol or recreational drugs; last traveled outside the United States to India 8 years earlier.
